title: Bribery Commission again files case against Johnston
body_lines: The Bribery Commission today (May 30) filed a case against MP Johnston Fernando and two others, charging them with using the employees of Cooperative Wholesale Establishment (CWE) for political activities while serving as the Minister of Cooperatives and Internal Trade.

Indictments were filed again today against former Minister Johnston Fernando, former CWE chairman Eraj Fernando and former CWE Working Director Mohamed Shakeer are accused of allegedly incurring a loss to the government to the tune of Rs. 8.4 million by using the CWE employees outside their scope of duties between January 01 and September 31 in 2010.

During the administration of the Government of Good Governance, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) had filed a case with the Colombo Magistrate’s Court against the trio pertaining to the aforementioned charges.

It was later withdrawn as the written sanction of the three commissioners of the Bribery Commission had not been obtained before filing the case. Accordingly, the Magistrate’s Court had ordered to release the three accused from the case.
However, the Bribery Commission filed indictments against the former Minister, the former CWE Chairman and its former Working Director today, naming 45 people in total as witnesses.
